a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality: Palma ratio (after tax), 1963 to 2022
The Palma ratio is a measure of inequality that divides the share received by the richest 10% by the share of the
poorest 40%. Higher values indicate higher inequality. Inequality is measured here in terms of income after taxes
